Random Forest Feature Importance
Ranks features based on impurity or permutation importance. Captures nonlinear interactions and works well even with noisy or correlated inputs.


Fits a separate model for each feature and ranks them by performance metrics (e.g., AUC, Brier score). Helps identify which features have strong individual predictive signal for PD.

Univariate analysis
Box Plot	Visualizes the distribution and outliers of individual numeric features. Helps identify skewness, extreme values, and differences across subgroups (e.g., defaulters vs non-defaulters).

Density KDE Plot
Provides a smoothed distribution curve of a feature. Useful to compare distribution shapes for defaulters vs non-defaulters and detect potential data leakage or need for transformation.
Univariate analysis
Violin Plot
Combines KDE and box plot for richer visualization. Helps assess both the distribution shape and summary stats (median, IQR) by target class.

Log of Odds Plot (Single Var)
Fits a univariate model, bins predictions, and compares actual vs predicted log-odds across feature values. Evaluates if the variable has a smooth, monotonic relationship with PD and if model calibration works.

Groups a continuous/categorical feature into bins and calculates Weight of Evidence (WOE) and target rates. Helps assess separation power and suitability for logistic regression.

Correlation Matrix
Examines pairwise linear relationships between features. Identifies multicollinearity, redundant features, and potential confounders.

SFA (Stepwise Feature Addition)
Iteratively adds features based on performance gain. Helps identify the most informative variables when added to a base model.

WITH base_data AS (
  SELECT
    EXTRACT(YEAR FROM SNAPSHOT_DT) AS YEAR,
    EXTRACT(MONTH FROM SNAPSHOT_DT) AS MONTH,
    HIGH_LEVEL_CATGRY_DESCR,
    CR_OR_DB_CODE,
    BORROWER_NAME,
    TRAN_AMT
  FROM
    `your_project.your_dataset.your_table`
),

borrower_stats AS (
  SELECT
    YEAR,
    HIGH_LEVEL_CATGRY_DESCR,
    CR_OR_DB_CODE,
    BORROWER_NAME,
    COUNT(*) AS TXN_COUNT,
    COUNT(DISTINCT MONTH) AS ACTIVE_MONTHS,
    AVG(TRAN_AMT) AS AVG_TRAN_AMT
  FROM
    base_data
  GROUP BY
    YEAR, HIGH_LEVEL_CATGRY_DESCR, CR_OR_DB_CODE, BORROWER_NAME
)

SELECT
  *,
  SAFE_DIVIDE(TXN_COUNT, ACTIVE_MONTHS) AS TXN_PER_MONTH
FROM
  borrower_stats





import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from sklearn.decomposition import PCA
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

def visualize_credit_segments_panel(
    df,
    features=['RISK_RATING', 'outstandings_amt'],
    date_col='prd_d',
    id_col='merged_src_ip_id',
    segment_col='commitments_amt',
    modeling_segment_col='MODELING_SEGMENT',
    window=(2014, 2017),
    segment_cutoff=3_000_000
):
    df = df.copy()
    df[date_col] = pd.to_datetime(df[date_col])
    df['year'] = df[date_col].dt.year

    # Filter window and select one record per obligor
    df_window = df[(df['year'] >= window[0]) & (df['year'] <= window[1])]
    df_snapshot = df_window.sort_values(date_col).groupby(id_col).first().reset_index()

    # Drop missing values
    df_snapshot = df_snapshot.dropna(subset=features + [segment_col, modeling_segment_col])

    # Create segment columns
    df_snapshot['commitment_segment'] = df_snapshot[segment_col].apply(
        lambda x: '≤3MM' if x <= segment_cutoff else '>3MM'
    )

    # Scatter Plot (Commitment-Based)
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(
        data=df_snapshot,
        x=features[0],
        y=features[1],
        hue='commitment_segment',
        alpha=0.5,
        edgecolor=None
    )
    plt.title(f'Scatter: Commitment Segment ({window[0]}–{window[1]})')
    plt.grid(True)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

    # Scatter Plot (Legacy Segment)
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(
        data=df_snapshot,
        x=features[0],
        y=features[1],
        hue=modeling_segment_col,
        alpha=0.5,
        edgecolor=None
    )
    plt.title(f'Scatter: Legacy Segment ({window[0]}–{window[1]})')
    plt.grid(True)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

    # KDE Plot (Commitment-Based)
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.kdeplot(
        data=df_snapshot,
        x=features[0],
        y=features[1],
        hue='commitment_segment',
        fill=True,
        alpha=0.5
    )
    plt.title(f'Density Plot: Commitment Segment ({window[0]}–{window[1]})')
    plt.grid(True)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

    # PCA Plot
    X = df_snapshot[features].values
    X_scaled = StandardScaler().fit_transform(X)
    pca = PCA(n_components=2)
    X_pca = pca.fit_transform(X_scaled)
    df_snapshot['PC1'] = X_pca[:, 0]
    df_snapshot['PC2'] = X_pca[:, 1]

    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(
        data=df_snapshot,
        x='PC1',
        y='PC2',
        hue='commitment_segment',
        alpha=0.6
    )
    plt.title(f'PCA Plot: Commitment Segment ({window[0]}–{window[1]})')
    plt.grid(True)
    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from sklearn.decomposition import PCA
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

def visualize_pca_all_windows(
    df,
    features=['RISK_RATING', 'outstandings_amt'],
    date_col='prd_d',
    id_col='merged_src_ip_id',
    segment_col='commitments_amt',
    modeling_segment_col='MODELING_SEGMENT',
    segment_cutoff=3_000_000,
    window_list=[(2003, 2005), (2006, 2009), (2010, 2013), (2014, 2017), (2018, 2021), (2022, 2024)]
):
    df = df.copy()
    df[date_col] = pd.to_datetime(df[date_col])
    df['year'] = df[date_col].dt.year

    for start_year, end_year in window_list:
        window_label = f"{start_year}-{end_year}"
        df_window = df[(df['year'] >= start_year) & (df['year'] <= end_year)]
        df_snapshot = df_window.sort_values(date_col).groupby(id_col).first().reset_index()
        df_snapshot = df_snapshot.dropna(subset=features + [segment_col, modeling_segment_col])

        df_snapshot['commitment_segment'] = df_snapshot[segment_col].apply(
            lambda x: '≤3MM' if x <= segment_cutoff else '>3MM'
        )

        # PCA
        X = df_snapshot[features].values
        X_scaled = StandardScaler().fit_transform(X)
        pca = PCA(n_components=2)
        X_pca = pca.fit_transform(X_scaled)

        df_snapshot['PC1'] = X_pca[:, 0]
        df_snapshot['PC2'] = X_pca[:, 1]

        # Trim PCA outliers
        lower_pc2, upper_pc2 = np.percentile(df_snapshot['PC2'], [1, 99])
        df_trimmed = df_snapshot[
            (df_snapshot['PC2'] >= lower_pc2) & (df_snapshot['PC2'] <= upper_pc2)
        ]

        # Plot side-by-side
        fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(16, 6))
        sns.scatterplot(
            data=df_trimmed,
            x='PC1',
            y='PC2',
            hue='commitment_segment',
            alpha=0.5,
            ax=axes[0],
            edgecolor='black',
            linewidth=0.2
        )
        axes[0].set_title(f'Commitment Segment (PCA) - {window_label}')
        axes[0].grid(True)

        sns.scatterplot(
            data=df_trimmed,
            x='PC1',
            y='PC2',
            hue=modeling_segment_col,
            alpha=0.5,
            ax=axes[1],
            edgecolor='black',
            linewidth=0.2
        )
        axes[1].set_title(f'Legacy Segment (PCA) - {window_label}')
        axes[1].grid(True)

        plt.tight_layout()
        plt.show()
